{{champion:240}} Is a more risky pick than karthus however he really slaps yasuo around early and as long as you gain a lead, yasuo will remain on the back foot until mid-late game.
Kled's main tool is his dash, as yasuo can't windwall a champ. So by using beartrap the moment you're on top of him, 9/10 times you'll hook him allowing you to get off all 4 empowered auto attacks+bear traps second proc. Or force him to disengage.
If yas happens to windwall you as you Q, you've likely hit him with your E, are now on enemy tower side of the lane and can re activate E to dash back towards your tower.

Add onto this the combination of surprise attacks {{champion:240}} can pull off with sneaky skarl returns and the innate cockyness of yasuo players, you're in for a great time. Pull it off and it will tilt yas off the face of the earth.
But be careful when doing this, be sure to build up your courage with pocket pistol before committing to a fight in which you're RELYING on skarl coming back b4 you die. There is nothing worse than being 2 auto attacks off skarl after you've used all of your W's enhanced AA's only do die before getting him back or while skarls running frantically at you.

Kled also has stronger roams than yas, especially since he's able to speed up his jungler for a gank down bot and he's very very good at diving. (As losing skarl automatically resets tower agro onto someone else).

Biggest flaws with this are: If you fail to kill yas, win lane and gain an admirable lead. You will drop of VERY VERY fast as you'll lack item/level advantages which are a necessity against yas' who build phantom dancer. The other side is that yasuo WILL! catch up and he will get to a stage where YOU! will never be able to 1v1 him. 
I usually start losing to {{champion:157}} when he has{{item:3046}}  and {{item:3031}}. That is not many items and so you do not have much time to abuse any lead you may have.
You MUST! be proactive, the moment his tower is down, ROAM ROAM ROAM ROAM ROAM! you need to get your team into a position in which they can help the falling off kled crush yasuo. Take all the outter turrets with roams (kled R) and nab them dragons the moment you start losing trades. 
And force your team to group either mid or bot for inhib/inner turrets. At this point you should have your core dmg items and a randuins. So it is your job to make yasuo's job as hard as possible in team fights (taking exhaust will ruin his day)

Yasuo doesn't see pro play not because of his weaknesses but because of other champions strengths.  The meta Champions for mid are champions who have the ability to one shot squishes without help from their team or having tanking on the enemy team have the ability to body block the damage.  In LCS  Tanks do more then engage team fights.  A good tank will body block skill shots, take ton of turret agro, face check most things to ward other things, and peel for the damage dealer (mainly adc).  But the meta for mid lakers right now are champions that don't let tanks do that.  {{champion:134}} {{champion:112}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:61}} are the top picks because they have the ability to do massive damage even when the tank is in the way.  Yasuo cannot do that.  Yasuo need lots of gold to be viable and a lot of team support.  A behind Yasuo will stay behind in LCS and he doesn't bring anything to the table for team fights if he isn't ahead where Orianna, Syndra, and Victor still bring CC lockdown and shields and peel.  Ryze is the perfect champion for LCS because he brings everything a team needs even when he is behind.  

I hope this helped

I might as well answer this as a Yasuo main with some points.

* Anything with targeted damage or CC can kill Yasuo as he is reliant on his E to dodge a lot of stuff and the logic that targeted abilities beat mobility.
* Build armor. Even a simple Rands can cut Yasuo's damage significantly. 
* Never 1v1 Yasuo while under a minion wave. Just don't.
* Treat him as an ADC: target him first.
* If the enemy has additional knockups that Yasuo can capitalize on, take whatever measures necessary to prevent him from ulting from that knock up.
* The Q is very short and narrow, side step it if you can when dueling him.
* When Yasuo pops his W or shield, back away, then re-engage, unless if the Yasuo chooses to engage when the circumstances permit.
* When his shield or W is down, take every opportunity to harass him. Bad Yasuo's will try to take in the damage and life steal out of it while good ones will often back or wait for the downtime of your skills so that he can go in.
* Do not try to sidestep Yasuo's empowered Q when retreating from him as he can hold on to it while he autoattacks you to death or until you blow your Flash or mobility spell only for him to fire the tornado towards your location. Remember that even with his Q, Yasuo is still reliant on his auto's for his damage.

But other than that, a good Yasuo is very infuriating to face.

As a person who plays Yasuo, {{champion:80}} makes every Yasuo player wish they never installed this game.

{{champion:80}}, probably one of the hardest lane for Yas since there is literally no way for Yas to trade properly. Yasuo's reliable damage source are his AA and Q (which is counted as AA); E can only be used so often on a certain target, and ult can only work on knocked target.

Panth's passive prevents AA damage, including Yas' Q. And Panth's W, which is also a stunt, refreshes the passive. Even though he could block Panth's Q with his W, Panth's Q is up more often and Yasuo's W has a long cooldown.

In short, the only reliable way Yas could fight Panth is by using his E, which has a cooldown on a target. Yasuo's main damage source are countered by Panth's passive. Not to mention, the moment Yas dashes near Panth, Panth could just all in Yas, stunting him with his W.

Oh yeah, Pant's passive also blocks the tornado part too.

1. Even the best counters will fail if you mess up the matchup. Know that his Level 1-2 is stronger than even some of his hardest counters. 
2. Toplane - Garen with a Cloth+5 start. Rush a Sunfire or a Randiuns if you arent comfortable in the matchup - you still outdamage him pretty much all game (aside from the aforementioned level 1-2). You can be behind in CS and build full tank and he still cant kill you while you can kill him (unless you get super far behind and Yasuo has 3-4 items while youre sitting on 2 defensive items). Renekton is a easy counter as well, but you do have to keep track of your rage. Darius is a "semi-skill" matchup. Darius is heavily favored, but if the Yasuo plays absolutely perfectly they can still win - at least until you get to 3 or 4 items when you can literally just facetank his damage and do nothing but auto/w him and ult. Jax is a "skill" matchup that still favors the Jax. Key is the counterstrike. If you dodge some of his autos and get the stun, you win. If he baits out your counterstrike and engages when its down, you lose. Trundle and Irelia are good into Yasuo as well, but you have to know the champion's strengths. Like for Trundle, only fight on your E - dont even try to fight when its down. Irelia has to use her Q resets to get into his range (dont engage directly with the Q, instead Q to a low-health minion near him). 
3. Midlane, I like Swain. E him when he is in range, use your Q to farm. Only go for the W-Q for damage if he dashes into you without a minion wave, cause he will just dash out of that damage. I like Swain because you can rush Rod+Zhonyas to directly deal with his damage without deviating from your champion's core build. If he tries to all-in you, kite back (out if minions so he cant dash) then drop all your abilities - you easily win post 6. Malz is pretty good as well, though the matchup gets more difficult once he gets QSS. Lissandra is good, but you have to be good at landing your W as he is trying to dash into you - if he gets to you before you get the spell off, it could be trouble. You can also pick something like Veigar to AFK farm, but he will still push you in - youll basically be farming under tower and be playing for teamfights. 
4. Take Exhaust. 
5. Outscale. Its weird to think of outscaling a Yasuo since he scales so damn well, but he is kinda like a Tryn - yes his damage scales super well, but his teamfight potential does not (without having proper setup with a Malphite or something). Pick a teamfight monster like Kennan or Annie, survive lane, then be more impactful later in the game.
